column2: NM DMV WRITTEN TEST
column4: New Mexico
column6: NM

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Always driving slower than other traffic:
column4: is always safer than driving faster than other traffic.
column6: is a good defensive driving technique.
column8: can block traffic.

column2: 2. A good rule of thumb for drivers sharing the road with a truck is:
column4: always try to stay alongside a truck, but never drive right behind it.
column6: if you can’t see the truck driver in their side mirror, they can’t see you.
column8: it is better to drive to the immediate right of the cab.

column2: 3. This sign means:
column4: Divided highway ends.
column6: Keep to the left.
column8: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.

column2: 4. Who is most at risk?
column4: Drivers who are fatigued.
column6: Long-distance commuters.
column8: Drivers who are driving on long, boring roads.

column2: 5. Taking drugs and alcohol together:
column4: is no more dangerous than alcohol by itself.
column6: helps you get rid of the effects of alcohol in your body.
column8: increase the risk of causing a crash.
column10: has no effect on your general driving ability.

column2: 6. When you back up:
column4: do it as fast as possible.
column6: you should rely only on your rearview mirror.
column8: always look through the rear window.

column2: 7. When is it safe to pass another vehicle?
column4: When you are driving through an intersection and there are no oncoming vehicles.
column6: When you are entering a curve and there are no oncoming vehicles.
column8: Whenever signs and/or markings permit passing other vehicles.

column2: 8. To avoid panic stops, you should:
column4: pump your brakes to make sure they work.
column6: scan the road ahead for hazards.
column8: drive with your window down.

column2: 9. When passing you should NOT:
column4: signal left to let others know that you will be pulling out.
column6: go far enough past the vehicle you are passing so that you can see the vehicle in your inside rearview mirror.
column8: leave less than 4 feet of space between your vehicle and the vehicle you are passing.
column10: look in your rearview mirrors and glance over your shoulder before pulling out to pass.

column2: 10. When following a motorcycle, drivers must remember that motorcycles can ____________ than other vehicles.
column4: stop much more slowly
column6: accelerate much faster
column8: stop much more quickly

column2: 11. If an aggressive driver cuts you off, you should:
column4: sound your horn.
column6: stay calm and get out of the aggressive driver's way.
column8: look towards the left side of the road.

column2: 12. This sign warns that:
column4: traffic must merge right.
column6: the bridge ahead is wide enough for only one vehicle at a time.
column8: the pavement ends.

column2: 13. At night, it is hardest to see:
column4: other motorists.
column6: street lights.
column8: road signs.

column2: 14. To avoid becoming an aggressive driver, you should allow enough travel time to reach your destination on schedule.
column4: True
column6: False

column2: 15. A driver cuts off another vehicle, or threatens another motorist or a pedestrian. These are examples of:
column4: excessive driving
column6: furious driving
column8: defensive driving

column2: 16. This road sign means:
column4: Divided highway ahead
column6: Two-way traffic ahead
column8: You can travel in either direction in this lane

column2: 17. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column6: Try pumping the gas pedal to increase pressure.
column8: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.

column2: 18. This road sign means:
column4: Cars in right lane must slow down
column6: Merging traffic ahead
column8: Pass only in the right lane

column2: 19. This is:
column4: a reduction of lanes sign.
column6: a right curve sign.
column8: a side road sign.

column2: 20. This sign is used to warn drivers about:
column4: road construction.
column6: changes in traffic lanes.
column8: drowsy driving.

column2: 21. If your accelerator becomes stuck while driving, you should:
column4: hold the steering wheel firmly and turn the ignition off while the vehicle is moving.
column6: shift to park and apply the brakes until you come to a complete stop.
column8: shift to neutral, apply the brakes and try to drive the car safely off the road.
column10: turn the engine off and try to drive the car safely off the roadway.

column2: 22. When you come to an intersection with a flashing red light, you must:
column4: slow down and drive carefully through the  intersection.
column6: stop at the intersection and wait for a flashing green light.
column8: stop only if cars are approaching the intersection.
column10: stop at the intersection, then proceed when safe and observe the right-of-way rules.

column2: 23. What do flashing red lights on a school bus indicate?
column4: The bus is stopped to load or discharge passengers.
column6: The bus is about to stop.
column8: You must pass the school bus.
column10: Traffic that approaches from either direction may proceed.

column2: 24. You are driving behind another vehicle and notice that the driver is driving with one hand, talking to a passenger. You as a driver:
column4: know that you should avoid this bad habit.
column6: know that the driver in the vehicle ahead is reducing his safety margin by being an inattentive driver.
column8: know that you should give the vehicle ahead extra room.

column2: 25. This road sign means:
column4: There is a series of sharp turns up ahead on the road
column6: Sharp right turn ahead.
column8: A road joins from the right
